node.title: Review: Young Concert Artists Is Back, With a Superb Pianist
node.description: Zhu Wang played an unusually interesting and adventurous set of pieces at Zankel Hall.

node.title: Biden and China’s Xi Will Hold Virtual Summit on Monday
node.description: The leaders of the world’s two largest economies confront tensions over trade, cyberthreats, the climate, Taiwan and human rights.

node.title: McDonald's CEO Seems to Blame Shooting Deaths of Kids on Parents, Faces Calls to Resign
node.description: McDonald's President and CEO Chris Kempczinski is facing backlash after saying parents of shooting victims Jaslyn Adams and Adam Toledo failed them.

node.title: 2 Charged With Stealing Over $1M in Unemployment Benefits, Business Loans During Pandemic
node.description: The case against Bryan Sparks and Autumn Luna is one of many that have rocked Washington state's Employment Security Department over the past year.

node.title: Joe Manchin Objects to Another Build Back Better Policy: Everything the Senator Has Opposed
node.description: The West Virginia Democrat has raised concerns about the massive social bill's impact on inflation and the national debt.

node.title: COP26: 'A fair degree of pessimism on a whole number of issues'
node.description: It is crunch time at the COP26 summit, and with one more day of official talks left there is plenty of pessimism among New Zealanders about the outcome.

node.title: Biden taps Robert Califf for FDA commissioner, and Manchin opposes
node.description: Califf also served in this role during the Obama administration.

node.title: Five Horror Movies to Stream Now
node.description: This month’s picks include mutants in love and mushrooms out for blood.

node.title: Review: The Cellist Sheku Kanneh-Mason Makes an Entrance
node.description: A young star made his New York Philharmonic debut in an evening of bold, charismatic musical storytelling.

node.title: Henry Ruggs Charged With Four Felonies After Fatal Car Crash
node.description: Prosecutors in Clark County, Nev., charged the former N.F.L. player with two felony counts of driving under the influence, two felony counts of reckless driving and a misdemeanor gun charge.

node.title: Fashionably Late to the Climate Crisis
node.description: How do you fix the fashion industry? This sustainability expert has a few ideas.

node.title: Will Real Estate Ever Be Normal Again?
node.description: In Austin and cities around the country, prices are skyrocketing, forcing regular people to act like speculators. When will it end?

node.title: Murkowski Announces Re-election Bid, Setting up Clash With Trump
node.description: Of the seven Republicans who found former President Donald J. Trump guilty in his second impeachment trial, the Alaska senator is the only one facing re-election this year.

node.title: California broadens access to Covid booster shots.
node.description: Officials are seeking to avert a winter surge; last year, so many Covid patients died that officials were forced to deploy mobile morgues.

node.title: Woman Filmed Giving Birth on Front Lawn by Doorbell Cam in California
node.description: "No one was expecting him to be born that day, definitely I wasn't," the mother, Emily Johnson, said.

node.title: Jury Suggests 28-Year Sentence for Joseph Elledge in Wife's Death, Made Decision in 7 Hours
node.description: Elledge admitted during the trial that he had buried his wife's body and misguided authorities for more than a year about her whereabouts.

node.title: Video of Joe Biden's 'Great Negro' Remarks About Satchel Paige Viewed Over 4.5M Times
node.description: The president during a Veterans Day speech at Arlington National Cemetery referred to Satchel Paige as "the great negro."

node.title: Why the Internet Is Feeling Sorry for a Robot: 'Screaming and Panic'
node.description: The robot installation has become the focus of online videos edited with sad music and filters, as people claim to feel sad for the machine.

node.title: 6-Year-Old's Lost Teddy Bear Becomes Park Ranger's 'Mascot' Before Going Back Home
node.description: A 6-year-old girl was reunited with the special teddy bear she received as an adoption gift.

node.title: Defense Attorney Apologizes for Black Pastors Comment During Racially Charged Arbery Case
node.description: Attorney Kevin Gough has received national blowback for asking the court to limit the number of Black pastors that were allowed to attend the case in Gerogia.

node.title: Woman Says Sister Is Trying to Steal Baby Name for Her Own 'Miracle' Baby in Viral Post
node.description: "I told her that she can name her baby whatever she wants, but that we're not changing our minds about our baby's name," the post explained.

node.title: USPS is delivering mail slower than promised ahead of holidays
node.description: The crucial holiday season poses a test for the postal service, which already has slowed mail delivery amid budget pressures.

node.title: Dazzling Accessories That Catch the Light
node.description: This season, stand out from the crowd with sparkly, crystal-encrusted bags and shoes.

node.title: The Ever-Evolving Art of Bonsai
node.description: The centuries-old craft is thriving as both a hobby and an art form, with contemporary practitioners around the world asking what lessons it can impart today.

node.title: Here’s the Secret to the Best Mashed Potatoes for Thanksgiving
node.description: You’ve tried boiling, but Genevieve Ko found a better way to make this side dish fluffier — and more flavorful.

node.title: Tales That Linger in Your Mind and Take up Residency in Your Soul
node.description: Our crime fiction columnist assesses three riveting new novels and an emotionally devastating short-story collection.

node.title: Picturing the Power of Community
node.description: Four invitations to reach across borders and affirm our shared humanity.

node.title: Like Riding a Bike: A Middle Grade Novel Asks, What if We Do Forget How?
node.description: In Alejandra Algorta’s “Neverforgotten,” illustrated by Iván Rickenmann, a baker’s son loses trust in himself, and has to gain it back.

node.title: Who Was Beatrix Potter?
node.description: The illustrator Joana Avillez delves into the life story of one of her favorite children’s book authors, creator of Peter Rabbit.

node.title: A Different Kind of California Dreaming
node.description: In Gayle Forman’s “Frankie & Bug,” a bittersweet coming-of-age novel, late-1980s Venice Beach is a living, breathing character.

node.title: This 18-Year-Old May Be the Key to America’s World Cup Hopes
node.description: Ricardo Pepi has played only four games for the U.S., but he provides the one thing his team needs most: goals.

node.title: Ethiopian Civil War Sparks Rancorous Debate over Immigration to Israel
node.description: Thousands of relatives of the remnants of Ethiopian Jewry are waiting to be airlifted to Israel. For now, the Israeli government sees no urgency.

node.title: In Border Crisis, Europe’s Unsavory Migration Deals Come Home
node.description: Europe has long paid other nations to keep refugees away from its borders. Now, Belarus wants something, too, and has brought migrants right to Europe’s door to get it.

node.title: ‘Be Nice to Tourists’: New York’s Arts Scene Needs International Visitors
node.description: The United States now allows vaccinated international travelers into the country. It’s welcome news for arts institutions that lost revenue and cut jobs during the pandemic.

node.title: Flights to Belarus Halted for Citizens in 3 Countries by Turkish Airlines Amid EU Pressure
node.description: The Turkish Civil Aviation Authority has stopped selling plane tickets for Iraqis, Syrians and Yemenis to Minsk, a popular illegal EU entry point.

node.title: China Lashes Out at Human Rights Watch for 'Fabricating Lies,' Politicizing 2022 Olympics
node.description: After the Human Rights Watch sent letters to the IOC's TOP sponsors asking them to be aware of human rights climate, China continued to deny violations.

node.title: Las Vegas Road Sign Saying 'Mash Potatoes Not Your Head' Branded 'Disturbing'
node.description: The sign appeared on the I-15 in Las Vegas, telling passengers to "buckle up."

node.title: Central Park's Touching Bench Plaques Pull at Heartstrings: 'Marry Me'
node.description: The heartwarming dedications have been viewed over one million times, and pay tribute to lost loved ones, or in some cases, propose marriages years early.

node.title: Trump Aide Mark Meadows Skips January 6 Testimony Despite Legal Threats
node.description: Trump's chief of staff when a mob of Trump supporters stormed the U.S. Capitol now faces potential criminal or civil action.

node.title: Black Officer Who Found 'KKK' Note on Raincoat From Ex-Police Chief Files Complaint
node.description: The former police chief made a "pointy KKK hat out of paper" and wore it in front of the officer and told him that he should wear that hat on his next call.

node.title: What to Cook This Weekend
node.description: We’ve put together a wonderful collection of Sidesgiving recipes, and you should explore those now.

node.title: Bruno Mars and Anderson .Paak Revisit Vintage Luxury as Silk Sonic
node.description: The duo gleefully reverse-engineers the analog-era sophistication of 1970s R&B on a new album, “An Evening With Silk Sonic.”

node.title: Taylor Swift and Phoebe Bridgers’s ‘Red’ Duet, and 14 More New Songs
node.description: Hear tracks by Beyoncé, Let’s Eat Grandma, Beach House and others.

node.title: The First English Translation of Hayao Miyazaki’s Favorite Childhood Book
node.description: Genzaburo Yoshino’s novel “How Do You Live?” may be the basis for the award-winning animator’s final film.

node.title: N.F.L. Fines Aaron Rodgers, Packers for Covid-19 Protocol Violations
node.description: Rodgers, the Green Bay Packers quarterback who is not vaccinated and has voiced unfounded claims about Covid-19 vaccines, was penalized for not wearing a mask in some places.

node.title: The number of workers quitting their jobs in September was the highest on record.
node.description: Nearly a million workers quit in leisure and hospitality businesses alone, reflecting the competition for workers after pandemic-induced shutdowns.

node.title: Husband of ‘Sweetheart Swindler’ Sentenced to 85 Years for Bilking Older People
node.description: Prosecutors said that Desiree Boltos and her husband, Paul Hill, stole more than $3 million from seniors who believed they were in romantic relationships with her.

node.title: A Mysterious Barrier Is Blocking Cosmic Rays at the Heart of the Milky Way
node.description: Scientists believe the area, known as the Central Molecular Zone, could shed light on the origins of cosmic rays that bombard Earth.

node.title: SpaceX Starlink Launch From Florida Rescheduled Due to Poor Weather
node.description: When the launch takes places, viewers will be able to watch the Falcon 9 lift off before it deploys a batch of 53 Starlink broadband satellites.

node.title: AY.4.2 COVID Variant No More Vaccine-Resistant Than Original Delta, Report Finds
node.description: The Delta sub-type is thought to be better at spreading than other forms of Delta, but does not appear to have an advantage when it comes to vaccines.

node.title: Austria to Place Unvaccinated Under Lockdown As Europe Fights COVID Surge
node.description: Chancellor Alexander Schallenberg said the lockdown is likely to be finalized on Sunday as the country grapples with record COVID infections.

node.title: Japan Adding 9,000 Hospital Beds Across Nation Ahead of New COVID Surge
node.description: Nearly 75 percent of Japan's population is fully vaccinated. Booster shots are expected to roll out next month.
